Review.Titre: Customer service is terrible
Review.Contenu: Customer service is terrible. I was accepted to lease the property.  I wanted to pay via direct deposit and was told my acceptance was cancelled because I didn't conform to their companies policies. A cashiers check was wanted. Still in the 20th century.

Review.Titre: I paid $45 for an application fee
Review.Contenu: I paid $45 for an application fee. Waited weeks and I received emails. Miss informing me I was advised I was in third place. Via email then I get an email saying I’m in first place only to call and be advised that I am in second place. This is like a joke. I insisted on a refund the life is a joke to this company.

Review.Titre: No matter how hard we try
Review.Contenu: No matter how hard we try, we cannot speak with anyone about what is happening. Very frustrating.

Review.Titre: I Choose to put some faith in Homerock…
Review.Contenu: I Choose to put some faith in Homerock in that same breath this company is associated with them. Overall horrible. Very unprofessional and negligent when it comes to calls and emails. This company is like so alarming it makes you think they are professional scammers in a way. I’m sure you could get a home but with everything that comes in between your better off going with a company with horrible reviews & I’m sure they will give better customer service and services overall

Review.Titre: The entire procedure was difficult
Review.Contenu: The entire procedure was difficult. The Findigs application portal was clumsy.  Often you could not get it to respond. We spent TWO weeks trying to complete an applcation with a coapplicant.  Ofcten it would say completed and sdubmiotted whern ity wasn't. We would nmot recommend this portal to anyone.Home Group was fantastic! We loved the homes. But the leases, like everyone else's, contained restrictions and clauses that we did not like. Very restrictive.

Review.Titre: Dismal UX
Review.Contenu: Dismal UXHere's an incomplete list of things that frustrated me about using Findigs to apply as a guarantor to another person's application:- Throughout the process it was unclear whether my status was actually guarantor and not tenant. It was impossible for me to specify that myself, and very little about the UI indicated it. I only proceeded when someone in the tech support chat confirmed.- Much of the form seemed like irrelevant questions for a guarantor but I couldn't proceed without answering them.- Several questions demanded information I couldn't provide (e.g. email address for a company that takes emails through an online form and doesn't expose a public email address). I had to dig around the internet to find the closest thing to correct because there was no way to say N/A or provide a note about the exception.- At the end of the form there was a prominent warning telling me I was applying to the place alone, in spite of prior assurance that my application was attached to the actual prospective tenant's. Tech support instructed me to ignore the warning and proceed, which had me quite nervous.- Charging a separate application fee to the guarantor is ridiculous. That should be covered by the main application fee.

Review.Titre: Expect days in between communication with Findig chat
Review.Contenu: I lost the first house I chose because it took over 2 weeks for my application to be reviewed by Findigs.  Then, on the second house I chose, it took 2 days on average to get a chat response from a Findig rep.  Pretty much the worst renting experience I’ve ever had…

Review.Titre: Invasive process
Review.Contenu: I felt like this was an invasion of privacy, they don’t need my Social Security number to approve for an apartment. The application fee is BS, just additional revenue.She is a very thorough and invasive process so I can understand why landlords like it, but it starts us off in an adversarial way, and I felt like I don’t really want to rent that apartment anymore after completing it.

Review.Titre: It was so difficult to navigate the…
Review.Contenu: It was so difficult to navigate the site and super time consuming. Might have been better for someone with more tech skills.

Review.Titre: No one is responding to me and the rent I was approved for is now increased without any communication
Review.Contenu: No one is responding to me. The lease is not correct. I was approved for a specific rent, the lease was written for more than I was approved for. I've sent multiple emails and chats and no leasing agent has called me.  The house was relisted for the same price I was approved for but yet you all are jacking the price up on the lease. Not a good experience and who would want to do business with a company like this

Review.Titre: Hiding your ludicrous $40 fee until the…
Review.Contenu: Hiding your ludicrous $40 fee until the END of the whole half-hour process is really shady.Why am I paying $40 to make everyone else's life easier, and for you to scrape a whole phonebook's worth of my information during the process for your database?No, I'm not actually interested in your answer. All I can say it's a tidy little income for you.

Review.Titre: DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY
Review.Contenu: My partner and i managed to find the perfect house right in the part of town we wanted to be in. We paid the non-refundable fees, filled out applications, even got a cosigner all while being told that we couldn't see the lease until the application was submitted. Once we were able to look at the lease, we found out that this company pushes all liability for water, mold, storm damage onto the renters, along with all utilities, yard maintenance, pretty much everything. If we were to have signed the lease and moved in. I'm very thankful we handed the lease off to my partner's uncle, who is a retired real estate lawyer, who was able to uncover the predatory actions of this rental company. to quote him "This lease agreement is one of the most aggressive, one-sided, fraudulent documents i have seen in my entire real estate career". Findigs' practices are shady, underhanded, full of fees to nickel and dime anyone smart enough to avoid the very likely financial ruin that would result from signing a lease with them.If i could give less than one star, i would.

Review.Titre: Customer service agent I am working…
Review.Contenu: Customer service agent I am working with is rude.

Review.Titre: Poor communication hard to talk with…
Review.Contenu: Poor communication hard to talk with who ever in charge.  Poor communication!

Review.Titre: Infernal bargain: give all your data to the cloud, now, to get a rental.
Review.Contenu: This was the most evil longwinded scary rental application I have ever experienced. The amount of personal data I had to give away was unbelievable. I got pitched to give me data away to other people numerous times. You asked to give Stripe and you complete access to my bank account. This was hell. This was an infernal, damned experience that made me feel naked and uncared for in a harsh brutal world. I hated this experience so much.

Review.Titre: I have never had to submit so much…
Review.Contenu: I have never had to submit so much personal data as I have for this application.  To obtain a simple lease on a low cost apartment a highly qualified credit score and employment check should suffice.  If Findigs is ever hacked so much of my personal data is compromised and Findigs takes no responsibility for it.

Review.Titre: Feels like a total scam
Review.Contenu: Feels like a total scam.  Took my money for application fee but I wasn’t able to see the home in person.   How do you rent a house without seeing it?

Review.Titre: Lied to, disappointed and discussed
Review.Contenu: I was not told that I would be staying on site. The place was up the street. I was given on unit and got a call and was told that it was not ready. They placed me in another unit and it was not ready either. It was not clean. Thick dust and spider webs on the ceiling fans and rack in laundry area. Electric sockets loose, stove not together and does not work, gap under the back door, refrigerator drawers does not put in correct, knobs missing off cabinets in kitchen and bathroom, blinds doesn't work, fire alarm missing, sink in bathroom can not be used, tub faucett held on by tape, some cabinets will not close, door stopper broken by front door, no front or back light, base board separating from wall in bathroom and a piece missing upstairs hallway, ants and roaches. I called the office to tell the I would wait on the other unit and they said no. The unit was given to someone eIse. I hope they did not get the special since it was not available on 11/30. I move in 11/30/2023 and have to wait until Monday to speak with office staff. I was not able to prepare food to eat for four days. I had to eat out those days.

Review.Titre: The application process is a circle
Review.Contenu: The application process takes you in circles. You do an app for a cosigner then since the cosigner obviously has to reference the tenants in their app then it sends the tenants another link to fill out an app. It's just a big circle.

Review.Titre: It’s hard to get in touch wi the…
Review.Contenu: It’s hard to get in touch with the anyone. The call center isn’t much help. The app doesn’t work great either!!!!!!!!!!! Our whole experience has been horrible. Hopefully it gets better overtime.

Review.Titre: so hard to use it didn't allow options…
Review.Contenu: so hard to use it didn't allow options to upload certain things another way or for like us people from outside USA soooooo hard

This app asks for way too much info. And it took 72 hours for my approval. When other apps took 24 hours. I would never recommend this app.

Review.Contenu: American ave can answer there calls and emails better and faster

Review.Titre: Communication is my biggest concern I…
Review.Contenu: Communication is my biggest concern I haven't talked to no one just text messages

Review.Titre: Applying for a new apt/townhome is way…
Review.Contenu: Applying for a new apt/townhome is way to extensive on this site. It is ridiculous of how much they require to complete the application. It took more than one 1 day to complete the application. Also, it doesn't let you know ahead of time what you will need on hand to complete the application. They don't mind wasting your precious time. And the help on here when you need it is nonexistent.

Review.Titre: Unethical business practice
Review.Contenu: Atlas rental company requires a customer to give them the rental deposit before allowing the client to view their actual lease agreement.  They also have a policy that they will not refund the clients deposit if they decide not to sign the lease.   I believe this is an unethical business practice and it’s disheartening to see this happening in my home town.  Why would a company not want to be upfront and transparent?

Review.Titre: Their response timing and whole process…
Review.Contenu: Their response timing and whole application process takes way to long

Review.Titre: Company cancelled my application with…
Review.Contenu: Company cancelled my application with out even talking to me. Requested additional documents while I was at work. By the time I got home and was able to sit down to get them out, they sent me a message saying they had canceled my application because I was taking too long. Like, do they want people to have jobs or not!?

Review.Titre: very frustrating process
Review.Contenu: Your website is not user friendly.  In my opinion the process to complete a 3 month short term lease on rental property should not be very complicated.  By the time I finally completed the lease I was totally frustrated and came very close to aborting the entire process.

Review.Titre: Terrible
Review.Contenu: Terrible, I hate the mandatory application fee even though we're already on the lease, plus an additional fee we're being asked to pay to modify the lease. This was not in the contract.

Review.Titre: Lack of Communication and poor judgement !!!!!
Review.Contenu: This application took me 6 days to finish because I own my own business and not the best at sending material online.  After completing my application, Abigail and Vania had me mixed up with another person with the same first name. They gave me less than 24 hours to sign my lease agreement. They didn't communicate at all!  I lost the townhome which I gave a $1,100 deposit before the other party ever did. Luckily, there was a townhome 2 doors down, that I am moving into. I should get back my $100.00 application fee from Findigs for their incompetence and lack of communication, but I probably won't. Wasn't a nice way to represent HomeRiver.

Review.Titre: Co-applicants did not link despite…
Review.Contenu: Co-applicants did not link despite using invites. Difficult to contact help. Lengthy process. Poor communication.

Review.Titre: Asking for user name and password
Review.Contenu: Asking for user name and password. Very uncomfortable with this. Providing 12 months bank statements. Too much. Pay stubs show all you need when salary take home is more than 5 times rent. Can’t pay with credit card?  Debit card has daily limits.

Review.Contenu: My experience was terrible. After applying for a house for DECA Property, I was told that I had to go through a third party called Findigs before I would know if im approved or not. Long story short, customer service is not there. When i messaged the person on the site, she messaged me once and then stopped responding.. now after ive applied and uploaded all documents FINDIGS worker went missing

Review.Titre: Nothing went right
Review.Contenu: Nothing went right. From the technology platform to the people to work with, to the policies the Owner’s management company deployed, it was a deplorable experience. Far too many roadblocks that it’s no wonder why the Owner has not been able to rent his property.

Review.Titre: System is not intuitive at all
Review.Contenu: System is not intuitive at all. Difficult to use and doesn’t retain info. Just to different screens

Review.Titre: I hope to never have to use this company again

Each person could not move forward without adding everyone in again and completing parts that were already completed so at the end there were triple the people with triple the cars. One of the applicants was blind and had such difficulty navigating the process and didn’t have any assistance where she was we just had her removed. I hope to never have to use this company again to apply for a rental

Review.Titre: Approval with no home

Review.Titre: Nicole and dime me to death...spent $40…

For a 1295/month place it was going to cos over 4000 dollars...get over yourself in a bad neighborhood and then give me  even MORE RESTRICTIONS!!!!  Nope!!! Review.Titre: Abyssmal experience -

Not quite, The property manager couldn't get an account set up for me without contacting "Chat" either. Your "Chatter" was Xyrisse.I've already told people about my terrible experience. I'll tell more whenever I get the opportunity.

Review.Titre: Promised move in date was changed after…
Review.Contenu: Promised move in date was changed after we paid to apply and were approved.

Review.Titre: nightmare website
Review.Contenu: awful nightmare website and FAQ section is just wrong and unhelpful. extremely difficult to use. couldn’t delete or restart an application or join anyone else’s. I chatted with an online representative and they were very helpful, but I shouldn’t have to ask someone to go in and do stuff for me on the back end to be able to do anything at all. took my partner and I 3 hours separately to fill out an application. -1/10

Review.Titre: Filling out this application was like…
Review.Contenu: Filling out this application was like burning in hell. Way too much crap I had to provide, and I had to do so much funky crap for my files to be recognize to be downloaded. I got drunk directly after completing this application because it was that stressful.

Review.Titre: My credit is good
Review.Contenu: My credit is good. My rental history is great. My employment earnings are high with all that being said the underwriter for this company told me I had to pay a double deposit and that I had to also pay an extra 35 a month for their benefit package which would’ve came to a total after move-in over $5000, the criteria that is being set by your company is more for a home buyer not a renter. I’ve never had evictions. My last rental deposit was $900 luxury apt

Review.Titre: Communication
Review.Contenu: Communication. A response to messages definitely when it comes to sending my money through somewhere like Walmart cash card and I am acquiring about information. I would love for someone to communicate back with me. It’s business day three now and still no response and I’m trying to make the payment but need more details first.

Review.Titre: The worst experience I have ever had…
Review.Contenu: The worst experience I have ever had with trying to rent a  vacation property. It felt like they tried to sabotage the deal at every turn. We ended up walking away from a property we wanted in a location we wanted. Terrible,terrible experience.

Review.Titre: Horrible experience all around
Review.Contenu: Horrible experience all around.  Can’t get a response from anyone. Only got a few responses at the beginning of application processes. The employees made a comment that they didn’t want to talk over the phone and instead they wanted to use Findings for all communication…red flag. Might be a good system if the Management Company using it was legit and not a total scam.

Review.Titre: This is stupid and shouldn't exist
Review.Contenu: This is stupid and shouldn't exist. These companies think using a service like this justifies jacking up the price, like student loans. Can we please stop with the third party everything? These fees are unnecessary, just price things reasonably.

Review.Titre: Very poor customer experience
Review.Contenu: Very poor customer experience. There was no one live to speak to when help was needed. Everything done by email. Never spoke to a person even though I had asked several times through phone and email to be called. Slow at receiving needed documents. What could have been done in 2 days has taken over a week and it's still not done!

Review.Titre: Retraining is needed
Review.Contenu: The individual responsible for putting together my lease needs to be re-trained.  She lacks attention to detail. She sent the document over 3 different times, each time with mis matching and wrong information.  I had an email out waiting for the information to be corrected.  While waiting 2 of her supervisors contacted me and told me that others were waiting for the property and if I didn't sign I would lose it.

Review.Titre: I have had/having a horrible experience…
Review.Contenu: I have had/having a horrible experience with Atlas homes. Nobody answers their phone, nobody will call upon request. I was approved on 10/16, they said someone would reach out to me with next steps, didn’t hear anything so I reached out. No call, email or message back. the house was rented to someone else. I moved my application to another home for a lower amount of rent and they said I needed a co-signer of someone who makes 6.5x the rent. RIDICULOUS. I found one, sent their email, never heard back a word. I spent the 55 to apply and 25.00 for the pet screening. Still trying to reach out to these people as I am approved and not getting any communication. All I need is a home for a year. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Review.Titre: Too much personal information
Review.Contenu: This application asks for waaaaay too much unnecessary personal information about my family.  There’s no reason that this company needs my children’s social security number and copy of birth certificate for a rental house application. They also say they don’t store your information, it is held by a separate company (that may or may not be in this country) and they can’t guarantee your information is safe. At your own risk kind of thing.. In the age we are in, I’m very surprised so much information is required.

Review.Titre: Military and veteran terrible experience.
Review.Contenu: Lost the opportunity to apply for a property because the automated software doesn't recognize a valid military extension for my wife's driver's license. Spent 3 whole days working with Findigs customer service with no success. Was pointed to the customer service of Everest and they took over 2 weeks to send an initial reply and still no resolution to the issue. Please contact me if you want more details or context.

Review.Titre: The experience was very overwhelming
Review.Contenu: The experience was very overwhelming. If you are working from a phone it is very difficult. The technology of capturing photos. And electrionic signatures became a challenge. The lack of support by phone is very needed.  In crawfordsville there would be a need for a navigator to help someone who can afford but doesn’t have technical expertise.  A navigator is needed to help through the process. It seems you can take the money but not truly help them understand the process.

Review.Titre: Difficult software
Review.Contenu: Difficult software! If your data does fit exactly as asked by the software, there is no alternative options.  The help desk even indicated they could not help.  We ended up sending in a paper application to the rental agency.

Review.Titre: I'm not able to communicate thru email…
Review.Contenu: I'm not able to communicate thru email and text.  Not sure why your reps cannot speak directly with the applicant, but I'll be sure to discourage anyone from applying with you using this process.

Review.Titre: KISS
Review.Contenu: The myriad of internet/webpage/email crap one has to deal with instead of going into an office, signing your name and handing them a check is overbearing and frustrating.  KISS is a common acronym for Keep is Simple, Stupid... and this process of getting an apartment is far from simple.

Review.Titre: No timely response on getting things…
Review.Contenu: No timely response on getting things done in the home.

Review.Titre: Lack of full disclosure.
Review.Contenu: Owner did not disclose that tenant is responsible for repair/replace of all appliances.  We never would have applied had that been disclosed prior to the application. We felt tricked by this. Based on the lack of full disclosure, in all fairness, our application fees should be refunded.

Review.Titre: You pay and noone calls on the App.
Review.Contenu: I was allowed to get on and pay for an app and then the house was rented. This happened twice before I could get anyone to contact me from Atlas.  Little did I know, the last house I would even slightly consider and had my app switched to was next to a major highway.  After being disappointed and not having any other housing options from Atlas I packed all my things in storage and left back to Tx. I wish for a refund.

Review.Titre: I don't understand how this site works
Review.Contenu: I don't understand how this site works. Nobody is around to help assist. I saw my application was approved, but nothing else. No further information was given regarding the application. No information on next steps. I don't know if I communicate with the leasing company through findigs.

Review.Titre: The wrong home address was on my…
Review.Contenu: The wrong home address was on my account and I paid mt money. No one is ever available to assist me nor do they respond in a professional timely manner.

Review.Titre: I was rushed and then nothing was…
Review.Contenu: I was rushed and then nothing was ready. The fridge doesn’t work, the water to washing machine doesn’t work, no cold water in the master shower. No one has contacted me about the walk through. After I paid the security deposit I was told that the rent was going to go up every year by at least $150

Review.Titre: Just not for me I found my own place…
Review.Contenu: Just not for me I found my own place and didn't have to pay all this deposit none refundable application fees

Review.Titre: My experience is horrible
Review.Contenu: My experience is horrible. I feel like I was catfished with the unit. I moved in on September first and to my surprise I had to find out on my own that there is no stove. The bedroom doors are missing, the walls have drawings on them, the laundry does not work, the laundry door is broken, the bathroom appliances are broken. The blinds are broken and the floor tile is lifting. I have been contacting maintenance and I have not heard back from anyone for 72 hrs.

Review.Titre: Almost couldn’t move
Review.Contenu: We initially missed out on the unit we were applying for because this website didn’t show the property that my co-signer had submitted his application. We were extremely lucky that another unit opened up, but I was extremely frustrated with the website.

Review.Titre: Zero communication
Review.Contenu: I have called, emailed and my daughter has called and emailed the company. No response! No one has attempted to reach regarding our approval and renting an Atlas Property.I would like our application fees refunded.Thank you!

Review.Titre: Deceitful application where large fees…
Review.Contenu: Deceitful application where large fees are hidden in tiny letters somewhere that you can’t see. Can’t even accept information from foreign applicants.

Review.Titre: Very user unfriendly website.
Review.Contenu: This is a very user-unfriendly website. Idk if it’s a security or fraud mitigation effort, but you cant do anything except enter your information in order, one time. No editing, no deleting, nothing. You put the info in and that’s it. Make a mistake, too bad. I had to delete an additional applicant and needed to contact customer service to do so. Some of the info you enter doesn’t have options you need to accurately answer the questions. Education was one of them for me (for one of my kids.) and they require full applications for minors including bank account and ID information. I kinda get it - we are in an age of insecurity and fraud, but their implementation is really unfriendly.

Review.Titre: Scam
Review.Contenu: Scam - cannot get a hold of anyone. I applied for a property and got an email back after paying the fees stating its no longer available. The chat said I needed to contact the property management company - the property management company said I needed to contact Findigs. I work for a property management company and this is sketchy and seems like they will just take your money - even though your application was not processed and you applied for a property that showed available to apply for.

Review.Titre: You should view the property you’re…
Review.Contenu: You should view the property you’re representing and contact those in person.It felt very much like a scam and much intimidation to sign lease with no questions answered.I will be following up with individuals in regards to the impersonal and bullying tactics.Denise Little

Review.Titre: This took ridiculously long
Review.Contenu: This took ridiculously long. We did our applications in June and this is just being finished now (8/21). I am not sure who to blame here, and this has been one of the most unprofessional processes I’ve ever been apart of.

Review.Titre: Don't like thier business
Review.Contenu: We got approved for a place paid our money only to get told we dont have the place someone else got it. Did the address transfer and not a word back from anyone all month. Dont like the way they do business. Why would you send multiple people an approved status for the same place. Definitely not a good look

Review.Titre: application process was very difficult…
Review.Contenu: Application process was very difficult it kept causing me to bid against myself. Its hard when you don't really have computer knowledge I am a senior citizen

The approval process took so long that by the time we were approved for a lease modification, it was well past the date we needed to switch roommates. In fact, our application only was approved after our leasing office reached out to the company. I think having a phone number to physically speak with representatives or customer service would be helpful.

Review.Titre: An absolute nightmare
Review.Contenu: This system is fully automated, has zero human interaction, and less than zero compassion. It made error after error, charged us multiple application fees, and in the end it resulted in declining a simple lease renewal.  We had been trying to work with this system for 60 days, with nothing but complete frustration, and no resolution. Trying to contact support was even more useless.  They publish a wordy mission statement - which the completely disregard.

Review.Titre: I was asked for income and there was a…
Review.Contenu: I was asked for income and there was a category for you to list child support and alimony, etc. but not allowed to use it as income. Then why are you asking for it and I’m sending bank statements proving I get it.

Review.Titre: M very unresponsive and untimely
Review.Contenu: M very unresponsive and untimely. They do not have a sense of urgency or empathy to resolve issues

Review.Titre: i've been talking to myself on that app…
Review.Contenu: i've been talking to myself on that app for weeks! can't even see the house i'm approved for! horrible experience all together

Review.Titre: REDSAIL PROPERTY worst experience I've ever…
Review.Contenu: This is the worst experience I've ever had in my 65 years on earth as for as customer service.  From REDSAIL PROPERTY. When I finally decided to use this company, I had to move because my current apartment is being renovated. I gave my deposit and other fees. The place was 1350, next thing I knew it was 1395. Next thing I knew was a 450 pet fee with $45 monthly and a 200 admin fee and a 40 a month fee fee.. After a long while I was approved. They sent me a lease via Docu sign. I did not sign it immediately because i wanted to discuss these fees. They sent the lease on the 17th of Nov. I didn't speak to a woman named Karri until the 21st of Nov. She explained to me and the coldest and unfriendly voice that I had no choice but to pay the fees. I was desperate so I agreed  and signed the lease.  A LEGAL DOCUMENT. On the 21st. I was told I had 48 hours after signing the lease. She then told me I had less that 24 hours to pay the deposits and fees by the next day on the 22nd. I informed her that I will try to be there but I normally get paid in the afternoon on a Holiday. The next day came around and I go paid at 3pm. When I called to bring the money. No one answered the phone. Then came Thanksgiving and the black friday. Then I called saturday still no answer. I kinda figured they were on vacation. So comes this monday at 10am. I brought the money to them to continue my moved and was told they cancelled my contract because I missed the one o'clock deadline. I apologize but informed them that I'm here with the money and the lease and the townhouse is available. That I already had my mail cable and electricity transferred. Because I had a signed legal lease. But they refused. I informed them I had the deposit and they closed early and went on break. Mr Karri refused to be one bit sympathetic to my situation. Some customer service. I had already given my current landlord a vacancy notice in 3 days and I have no place to live as of now. These people were callous and cut throat. No compassion and service. I'm sure that if I was a friend or relative, they would've worked with me. But I'm not. To putting and old man in the street. I might have to live and a very cheap hotel until some of rental place have enough time to approval me application. I pray I don't get robbed or hurt. I need legal help!!! And they kept my application fees. Remember their name is REDSAIL PROPERTY. Go somewhere Customer service is horrible in my opinion

Review.Titre: confusing UX choices
Review.Contenu: There were a few confusing UX choices, but the biggest one was that options for guarantors don't show up until after the "submit" button. For someone who needs a guarantor, that choice produces a lot of anxiety. We opted to add the Guarantors as co-applicants (this is the section where you'd expect to see the option) to make sure the information was there somewhere. This caused a cascade of problems.Other issues: your ID verification seemed like it couldn't focus the camera. I've never had such difficulty before. "Other ways to pay rent" is only structured as recurring income, so there is no accurate way to report lump sums like retirement or mutual funds.

Review.Contenu: The verification process was very uncomfortable.  The system requires all of my personal informaiton without establishing a base relationship with a real person.  it is very unsetteling that I basically put all of the information that makes me who I am in America into a black hole and not knowing anyone I can contact or deal with on the other end. Secure for you, but what about the consumer/customer/tenant/person. We want assurance as well. It's very scary and I don't want to be scammed just like the company doesn't want to be scammed! Human contact is still important!

Review.Contenu: I found a great apartment,  filled out an application and was approved.  When I asked where the lease was to sign they did not reply.  On the third ask they told me the owner had made a mistake on the monthly rent and that they were asking for substantially more.  It fell through and now I have to start over with my search. Granted it was the owners who made the mistake but I felt the communication was lacking on the part of Findigs.

Review.Contenu: $100 for me to apply to rent a place is ridiculous. Additionally, after I paid first month's rent, security deposit, and a $500 "administration fee" I finally saw the lease that was filled with all sorts of fees and rules to screw over the renter. I know the lease is not Findigs fault. But this whole process was a huge turn off. I did not accept the terms of the lease in the end. So thats $100 to Findigs I'll never see again.

Review.Contenu: This process is very confusing and cumbersome. After applying nobody really followed up to explain the process. I have found several homes that we liked and attached to different addresses to our application. The first time we didn’t get because it went off the market then it came back on the market. In addition to this, Excalibur homes definitely Photoshop some grass into the yards of the homes in their site. I have driven past several that have pure dirt yards but in the photos it is plush green grass. I think this company knows they have a monopoly for single-family home rentals in Atlanta, and have gotten away with quite a bit.

Review.Contenu: the carpet and baseboards were dirty not sure who the cleaning crew is but they did not do a good job at All refrigerator. Missing shelves showerhead is broken.

Review.Contenu: Co applicant process was incredibly difficult because of the email links and group pairing of accounts. It shouldn’t be that difficult and is not user friendly what so ever. It only worked for us because we got in contact with an agent.

Review.Contenu: Everything No personal enter action The application did not leave any room for explanation of answers When we tried to call someone they said everything is on computer If I can avoid it I will never have any thing to do with this company again

Review.Contenu: We had to deal with way too many people.   So many texts and emails from different people, different names, different "companies".   It got very confusing and seemed unnecessary for the most part.   It took 3 of us so long to rent this home. It was difficult to keep track of who wanted what from us.  We're thankful to have rented the home.

Review.Titre: They were pretty quick to draw up a…
Review.Contenu: They were pretty quick to draw up a contract and take my money. However, when it came time to hand over the keys, they neglected to give me access to the property. The lockbox was located behind a gate to which I did not have access to. They failed to provide me the PIN number I needed to open the gate so I can enter the property. There is no other way to enter the property without going through the main gate. I emailed and texted numerous times without receiving a response. I was planning on taking advantage of the three-day Labor Day weekend to move, but now due to the lack of communication from this company I will have to make other plans.  Hopefully someone will read this review and make things better!

Review.Titre: This company is very unorganized.
Review.Contenu: This company is just very unorganized. I just got a house through findings with some friends but it wasn’t easy at all. The first time we tried to submit an application something happened and the application wouldn’t go through. We called findings multiple times to let them know and it took them 3 weeks to finally get it resolved. By the time they fixed it, the house had been leased. We were able to transfer the application to another house, but we still had trouble with that. We called to get the application moved and they entered the wrong address. It took another week to get that fixed. Overall this process was very stressful because findings couldn't do their job.

Review.Titre: Tedious and intrusive
Review.Contenu: We found this site to be utterly frustrating to use.  I'm sure that some frustrations we due to the requirements set forth by the property management, the intrusive information about our finances was ridiculous.  Why would we send that much information to anyone? It took us almost four hours to complete the application.  Which we, for some reason, were denied the opportunity to cosign for our daughter.  We were told that we did not qualify to be cosigners on a $2400 lease even with spotless criminal records, a credit rating of over 800 and a significant net worth.  Both my husband and myself filled out an application--with exactly the same information...why?????  We finally came to a rather unsatisfactory agreement with the property manager, but, my daughter decided to forego the property, which was fine with us...it seemed like more trouble than it was all worth.

Review.Titre: Difficult to get in touch with a…
Review.Contenu: Difficult to get in touch with a person. Buttons don’t work half the time on the mobile version. Application process had a lot of glitches when it came to linking with co-applicants.

Review.Titre: Very intrusive!
Review.Contenu: This is the most intrusive rental process I have ever encountered. There is no reason I should have to enter personal contact information for my boss at work, certified verification of the degree program my wife is pursuing, or my bank login information. Although I was able to compromise with the property management company to bypass some of the “required” information, the app would not let me continue without entering the data it was looking for. Overall this drew out the application process to multiple weeks.Then, when managers used the app to contact me about my application, they would send multiple chats at a time (which is completely normal) and the app would send the same chats via text and email multiple times, leading to a cascade of notifications every time I received a message. Overall, I would recommend a less intrusive, less in-your-face system of communication with landlords/property managers. I don’t want renting to resemble social media, and I need to be able to make informed choices about my data privacy and information protection.

Review.Titre: Needlessly complicated
Review.Contenu: Needlessly complicatedThe entire process had so many different parties, with zero overlapping accountability or responsibility, where each party was able to blame problems on another person without working with us to try to fix the issue. We did not get our keys on time, we did not get clear communication about the items in our lease that were vague or nonsensical, and absolutely no one involved apologized for all of the confusion.

Review.Titre: Meaningless notification email harassment.
Review.Contenu: Response time was slow (though perhaps the leasing agent just didn’t give a shart), and Findigs sent me WAY too many unsubstantive notification emails and marketing emails that I didn’t sign up for. You don’t need to harass me with emails, just leave the notifications on Findigs.

Review.Titre: House for Rent was put up for sale
Review.Contenu: I applied for a house for rent - should have been a simple process - everyone had recent paystubs and solid credit. Every time I submitted a document it took days to review and then they would ask for another document - another 2-3 days. Finally after 3 weeks of going back and forth we finally got the approval. I emailed to ask what the process was after our approval and the woman replied that I was not approved even though I got an email that said I was the day before. I had to submit a copy of the email to prove I was indeed approved and the employee responded with "CONGRATULATIONS. Wait for a call from us."I received an email saying that when presented the approved application, the home owner decided to sell the house so it is not available for rent anymore. Complete waste of time and money.They did offer a refund on the application fees but I still got a ding on my credit and of course it's been days and I have not received a response about the refund.

Review.Titre: The application process was very difficult to navigate.
Review.Contenu: The application process was very difficult to navigate. The application itself was very thorough and detailed, which was good.  It took me about 4 hours to complete the application for myself, my wife and my dog (yes, my dog had to apply also) Requirements for pay stubs were difficult to attach.  I was notified by email on several occasions of time sensitive information on a chat that was not accessible by my phone, or on my computer.  The chat app. did not open 90% of the time.  I was never able to talk to a real person by phone.  Delayed communication between the chat operator and a third party that was responsible for my lease, resulted in cancellation of my application and loss of the opportunity for the rental. The rental management agency attempted to assist with the short fall in communication, but was unable to break the communication gap.  I would avoid any rental application that uses this app as a qualification step for rentals.

Review.Contenu: We could have moved in to 5117 Blackelm McKinney, TX, but it took the owner a long time to respond so we had to rent another house. We had a deadline to move, and the owners took their time.

Review.Titre: Poor communication and technical issues
Review.Contenu: We submitted our applications and received the confirmation email. By two days later, we hadn't heard anything else so we reached out to the Property Management company who said none of our reports came through from Findigs. It was difficult getting in touch with anyone at Findigs since the only option is a chat. I was able to get ahold of someone when I opened the chat, but it took the individual over 25 minutes to respond, resulting in an expired chat that kicked me out. I tried a few times to get back in to a chat but it would not connect. I had to reach out to the Property Management company again and tell them I could not get ahold of anyone, so they said they would call. I was able to get back in to a chat later in the day, and was told our applications experienced a "technical issue" and that we could not be provided a time when it would resolve. This was very stressful since the Property Management company could not move forward with anything without our reports. A day or so later our reports finally went through and it delayed are ability to get an approval and send our deposit to the Property Management company. Findigs is a great idea, but for something as important and time sensitive as renting a home, there should be more urgency and a better avenue for communication

Review.Titre: The system was very inflexible and…
Review.Contenu: The system was very inflexible and impersonal. I have never dealt with a third party system for a rental. The actual log in to add information was not user friendly. There were no options if you did not have what was requested. I was in CA and my dogs shot info was in MI. I called my vet and they never emailed it to me. I did not have it. I was emailed NON stop. I have over 18 emails DEMANDING my dogs shot records. This added to the stress of the move. I felt I was going to lose the perfect rental because of my dogs shot records. Some of the replies were not very nice. I felt harassed. I appreciate the importance of good background information but try to fill out your own form and see how easy it is. For example, it asked for my landlord's email. I have been renting for over 10 years and NEVER had a landlord's email. It would NOT allow me to skip that spot. At the time I was filling out the information in CA, my landlord was fast asleep. I was not going to wake her up for her email address. I just found it very impersonal and frustrating. I can tell you, if I have a choice between two rentals and the one I like better uses this service and the other does not, it could be a deciding factor as to which one I move forward with. Granted, my nerves could be running high, making this move from Michigan to CA. River View was great to work with and the house is lovely. The process was harrowing.

Review.Titre: A little too slow
Review.Contenu: I wish the process after application went faster, and I could have been approved faster. I took a different apartment as it took 6 days to hear anything back that I was accepted. I figured I didn't hear back after almost a week so I took the other apartment. I think it's important to remember a lot of people are probably applying for multiple apartments, so time is critical. The apartment I ended up taking had everything completed in two days. Positive things, the application process is easy and not largely time consuming. Very thorough too, which I believe would certainly remove less than desired tenants. That is solid. I have nothing bad to say, I just wish it was faster.

Review.Titre: Difficulties if not an American
Review.Contenu: It was relatively difficult for me to use Findigs as a Canadian international student in the US. I don’t have a SSN or an ITIN, so I cannot be credit checked. Fortunately I was connected to staff right away through a live chat and was given an override for the SSN section. Also, I could not enter any address information from Canada, as there was no “country” dropdown or selection ability, but I have a permanent residence address in Canada that my tax information is connected to. Even the US government and my university allow me to input an address from another country as my permanent residence for tax purposes. I know that I am likely in the minority of people who run into this problem on Findigs, but international students, people with work visas, etc, do exist and these issues can be really frustrating. The Findigs system is very easy to use otherwise. They have it streamlined and I was able to fill everything else out quickly. I did appreciate the ability to chat with someone if I needed help. Pretty user-friendly interface.

Review.Titre: Rental 'RULES" not family oriented
Review.Contenu: 1st team - (rental applicants, qualifier) have done a wonderful job KUDOS for them.2nd team - (leasing contract, house rules provider NOT SO MUCH.they don't even return your phone call. Properties unless for senior renters only, must be family oriented. The reason I had to back out from my rental offer after Credit checks, Income checks, backgrond  cks., etc. Good luck !!!

Review.Titre: uploading documents there should be an…

Long story short emails were sent and this issue was resolved,  applied for new property and everything went smooth sail… turns out I never needed an offer letter. Moving in my new home soon !

Real Estate is still a people business and to give me this document without benefit of means to discuss or ask questions is usually a deal keller for me. I don't really expect you to view it as a people business or to change your Guidelines because you won't.

Once because the system didn’t catch when another tenant paid before me & another when we were told AFTER agreeing upon a property that it was being remodeled. Third house is the house we finally received a lease on.

Review.Titre: Don’t like you have to pay all that…
Review.Contenu: Don’t like you have to pay all that money just to see inside a house. Anything can happen where the company don’t answer and you lose your money companies spam people to

Review.Titre: Easy to Use, but Highly Invasive
Review.Contenu: You were super easy to use…. but I felt strong armed into sharing pictures/information that I was not comfortable sharing. Unfortunately, we needed housing and the property management company forced us to use you. I felt like I had to pay for your invasion of my privacy without any clarity on your data policies.I have no idea how long you are retaining my data. What evidence do I have that my data and images are deleted from your server now that my application has been approved? How do I know that you are appropriately protected against cybersecurity hacks?

Review.Titre: The site kept kicking me out and…
Review.Contenu: The site kept kicking me out and restarting in random places in the application. It took me over two hours to complete and would not allow me to go back and change/correct items that had been entered.

Review.Titre: I prefer a more personal experience
A system needing improvements
Review.Contenu: It took me over 2 hours to fill out the application, far more time than I had.  The application requested income sources but there was nowhere for me to add resources that I had from which I was not taking income.  I wanted to include a copy of my last tax return but there was no way to do that.  Instead of paying a month's security, I was required to pay 2 which I am not happy about.

Review.Contenu: All communication was via e:mail and text.  I would prefer a direct connection with the company via a phone call with the person in charge of the review process.  Not having any idea when approval would occur was very stressful.

Review.Titre: A confusing experience on one section
Review.Contenu: Findings seems like a good company - helpful and courteous It might be my lack of tech skills, but I had a very frustrating time on the financial section1. My bank would not come up except with - loans, & I have no loans, & that is what any questions were about - couldn’t give any information & it didn’t take my account numbers, so I don’t even think it was my bank listed with the loans.2. I could give one of my Pensions, but Social Security doesn’t list the U.S. Gov as a business.  I also give piano lessons as a part time business, but there was not a place to add that without a business name & license.*The rest of the app was fine, but I spent a LONG time trying different approaches to give my income & only had my one pension as a total income listed in the end.I guess it ended up OK, but the financial section didn’t fit my profile well.  I would have gone into the office, but I live in the Detroit area.

Review.Titre: A little Confusing
Review.Contenu: It just got confusing when I had to put a different email for my spouse and for them to fill out an individual. We also had to fill out another application for an adult with disabilities. He can't fill out his own and he will just be an adult in the house. If they could have an additional adult button within the one application that would be so much easier. I understand the landlord needing to know about all the adults in the house but it was hard for me to manage 3 applications. My wife isn't good with computers especially uploading documents. It was also confusing that our information was sent to the landlord for them to approve or not approve. It took me a while to understand the chat feature to upload more information. I was lucky that their was someone I could text on the leasing officer side to tell me to upload in the chat. I think that over all it was a pretty decent way to apply and to get the documents. Thank you for asking for feedback

Review.Titre: In general the process was ok.
Review.Contenu: In general the process was understandable.The linkage between applications in a group was not clearly labelled.Also, after each applications was finished there were multiple emails, that was confusing.  Just one confirmatory email is enough.

Review.Titre: Kind/courteous staff but slow responses
Review.Contenu: The application process, and status indicators on the website were really nice. Also the notifications each time an applicant finished a given portion of the application were very useful. Our main reason for 3 stars rather than 5 was a lack of communication combined with significantly delayed responses. I had to call the office multiple times, each time I was given a timeframe of 24-48hrs in which a decision would be made, and each time we waited 3-5 days. This delayed our move in significantly which is quite stressful when trying to coordinate moving out of one place and into the other, and resulted in not being able to schedule movers due to the short timeframe and proximity to the end of the month. In the timeframe between applying and our first response, we were approved for and gave up another property. This does not seem to be the norm given the other reviews we saw, so I’m not sure what the cause of this was.  That being said, everyone in the office was very helpful and courteous, and calling was never much of a hassle, also we did finally get approved and moved in.

Review.Titre: The application was a bit wonky and at…

Review.Titre: This company could be better at…
Review.Contenu: This company could be better at communicating with potential clients. My family and I were moving from one state to another and needed a place before arriving.  There was three weeks ( which we understand is a short period of time) between the time of our move. We got all of our information in the same day we found a place we liked, but no one responded for about 3 1/2 days later to say we needed extra info. We uploaded that information within 24 hrs and still didn't get a response for another 2 days. Once we got a response,  the house we applied for was taken, we were instructed to choose another home and it wouldn't take but about 2-3 days to hear back. We choose another home from the site, and We didn't hear anything for 4 days saying, that house we selected was taken as well.  In the meantime my family is already on the move to head to our new state in hopes we'd have something within a few days, but no message or call or any updates until the third day of our hotel stay. By then we had already signed a lease from another company with a sure move in date. We had to pay the $75 per adult,  just to get the run around for three whole weeks, it's sad that you guys are charging people this fee, knowing that you're going to drag your feet and let as many people apply, just to keep saying the house is taken. At least offer a portion of the people's application fee back, it's ridiculous.

Review.Contenu: Most issues occurred when trying to add a coapplicant on the application. We both started an app without realizing we needed to send the co-signer link first and use that. When we tried to use the link an error occurred when we said we wanted to start over with a fresh application. It finally allowed us to add the coapplicant when we changed the address on one of our two applications, invited the other, and chose start new app. It never did show up that we were applying with each other though. We were told by the helpline that they were linked on his end, so we should submit even though it appeared on our end we were submitting separately.

Review.Titre: Made a stressful process simple
Review.Contenu: Going through the application process is stressful. However, FinDigs made it simple with their UI that walks you through the process. One area of improvement would help make it much more clear that a use can upload docs versus using only Bank Statement or Payroll processing apps.

Review.Titre: Family Reunited
Review.Contenu: We were trying to relocate our elderly parents, so that they can be taken care of by family and Findigs made this possible without jumping through hoops. Where other companies didn't respond to us but they took our money without the courtesy or acknowledgement of our application.

Review.Titre: I love my home
Review.Contenu: Taylor was a sweetheart. When I first started the process, I was afraid of being scammed because everything was boarded down, and the first processor was really slow about things. Once I spoke to Taylor I felt more comfortable moving forward and I'm really glad I did because my home is beautiful.

Review.Titre: THANK YOU home river!!!

Review.Titre: Application was approved in less than a…
Review.Contenu: Application was approved in less than a 1 day. But filing out the application was painful and very long to complete...  On top of all my financial, employment, credit, banking and legal history, why do you need the weight, the age ,a picture and color of my cat + her vaccine certificate or a picture of my vehicle after I provided all the details ? Applying for a mortgage is actually less intrusive. All in all, I do appreciate their speed and fully online process.

Review.Titre: Work hard to help tenants and owners come to an agreement
Review.Contenu: Helped us find a new place to rent in a timely manner. They also worked with us to modify the contract with the property owner to fit our needs. Felt like they really wanted to help landowners and potential tenants come to a suitable agreement and all in written contract to make it official down to the smallest detail.

Review.Titre: The instructions for getting in were…  Easy and thorough
Review.Contenu: The instructions for getting in were easy and thorough.  The condo is very nice with enough furniture and kitchen utencils.   The view from the upstairs deck is great with ocean and sunset views.  The home needed a lot of touch up cleaning. With a $400 cleaning fee, the cleaners did a quick half hazard job with crums under the kitchen cabinets, dirty counter tops, etc...   The worst was the outside patios.   They were not swept or hosed down at all and lots of cob webs.  We did contact property management and they did send a cleaning crew out right away.  The home could use some patio furniture for the downstairs patios and additional chairs for the upstairs patio.  In a perfect world, they would have a small high top table with high chairs which would be great for enjoying the nightly sunset...    Also, there is no BBQ.  Lastly, the plants and flower beds are really bad and totally neglected.   But, once again, management came through and allowed their handy man (Warren) to come in and trim dead shrubs and lay down mulch.  Warren went over and above to make things right.
